place.name: OXHILL
place.gazetteerText: OXHILL, a village and a parish in Shipston-on-Stour district, Warwick. The village stands on an affluent of the river Stour, 2½ miles W N W of the boundary with Oxfordshire, 3 E S E of the Fosse way, 4¼ S S W of Kineton, and 9½ S E of Stratford-on-Avon r. station. The parish comprises 1, 668 acres. Post-town, Kineton, under Warwick. Real property, £2, 527. Pop., 373. Houses, 91. The property is much subdivided. The parish is a meet for the Warwickshire hounds. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Worcester. Value, £354.* Patron, W. D. Bromley Davenport, Esq. The church is Norman, with a low tower; and the chancel was recently restored. There are a Wesleyan chapel and a free school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
